intro: Bonafousia angulata, commonly known as the angular leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, angular leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds, aiding in its propagation.
